1.text: Therefore when the Lord knew that the Pharisees heard that Jesus makes and baptizes more disciples than John,

2.text: (Though Jesus himself immersed not, but his disciples,)

3.text: He left Judea, and departed again into Galilee.

4.text: And it was necessary for him to pass through Samaria.

5.text: Then comes he to a city of Samaria, called Sychar, near to the place which Jacob gave to Joseph his son.

6.text: And Jacob’s spring was there. Then Jesus, wearied with the journey, sat thus by the spring: it was about the sixth hour.

7.text: A woman of Samaria comes to draw water: Jesus says to her, Give me to drink.

8.text: (For his disciples were gone into the city that they might buy food.)

9.text: Then says the Samaritan woman to him, How thou, being a Jew, askest of me to drink, being a Samaritan woman? for the Jews have no intercourse with the Samaritans.

10.text: And Jesus answered and said to her, If thou knewest the gift of God, and who he is saying to thee, Give me to drink: thou hadst asked him, and he had given thee living water.

11.text: The woman says to him, Lord, thou hast no vessel for drawing, and the well is deep; whence then hast thou the living water?

12.text: Thou art not greater than our father Jacob, who gave us the well, and he himself drank of it, and his sons, and his young animals.

13.text: Jesus answered and said to her, All drinking of this water shall thirst again:

14.text: But whoever should drink of the water which I shall give him, shall never thirst; but the water which I shall give him shall be in him a spring of water springing up to eternal life.

15.text: The woman says to him, Lord, give me this water, that I thirst not, nor come here to draw.

16.text: Jesus says to her, Retire, call thy husband, and come here.

17.text: The woman answered and said, I have no husband. Jesus says to her, Thou sayest well, That I have no husband:

18.text: For thou hadst five husbands; and now he whom thou hast is not thy husband: this thou saidst true.

19.text: The woman says to him, Lord, I see that thou art a prophet.

20.text: Our fathers worshipped in this mount; and ye say, that in Jerusalem is the place where they must worship.

21.text: Jesus says to her, Woman, believe me, that the hour comes, when neither in this mount, neither in Jerusalem, shall ye worship the Father.

22.text: Ye worship what ye know not: we worship what we know: for salvation is of the Jews.

23.text: But the hour comes, and now is, when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and truth; for also the Father seeks such worshipping him.

24.text: God a Spirit: and they worshipping him must worship in spirit and truth.

25.text: The woman says to him, I know that Messias comes, called Christ: when he should come, he will announce all things to us.

26.text: Jesus says to her, I am he speaking to thee.

27.text: And upon this his disciples came, and they wondered that he spake with the woman: yet none said, What seekest thou? or, Why speakest thou with her?

28.text: The woman then left her water buckets and departed to the city, and says to the men,

29.text: Come, see a man, who told me all which I ever did: is not this Christ?

30.text: Then went they forth out of the city, and came to him.

31.text: And in the mean time the disciples asked him, saying, Rabbi, eat.

32.text: And he said to them, I have food to eat which ye know not.

33.text: Then said the disciples to one another, Has any one brought him to eat?

34.text: Jesus says to them, My food is that I might do the will of him having sent me, and finish his work.

35.text: Say ye not, That there is yet the fourth month, and harvest comes? behold, I say to you, Lift up your eyes, and behold the countries; for they are already white for harvest.

36.text: And he reaping receives wages, and gathers fruit to eternal life: that he sowing might rejoice together and he reaping.

37.text: For in this the word is true, That one is sowing, and another reaping.

38.text: I sent you to reap that with which ye have not been wearied: some have been wearied, and others have come into their labor.

39.text: And many of the Samaritans of that city believed in him for the woman’s word testifying, That he told me all which I ever did.

40.text: When therefore the Samaritans came to him, they asked him to remain with them: and he remained there two days.

41.text: And many more believed on account of his word;

42.text: And they said to the woman, That we no more believe for thy speaking: for we ourselves have heard and know, that this is truly Christ, the Saviour of the world.

43.text: And after two days he came out thence, and departed to Galilee.

44.text: For Jesus himself testified, that a prophet has no honour in his own country.

45.text: When therefore he came to Galilee, the Galileans received him, having seen all which he did in Jerusalem in the festival: for they also came to the festival.

46.text: Then came Jesus again to Cana of Galilee, where he made the water wine. And there was a certain royal one, whose son was sick in Capernaum.

47.text: He, having heard that Jesus was come from Judea to Galilee, went away to him, and asked him that he would go down and heal his son: for he was about to die.

48.text: Then said Jesus to him, Except ye see signs and wonders, ye would not believe.

49.text: The royal one says to Him, Lord, go down before my child dies.

50.text: Jesus says to him, Go; thy son lives. And the man believed the word which Jesus said to him, and he went.

51.text: And he already going down, his servants met him, and announced, saying, That thy child lives.

52.text: Then he inquired of them the hour in which he was attended to. And they said to him, That yesterday the seventh hour the fever left him.

53.text: Then the father knew that in that hour in which Jesus said to him, That thy son lives: and he believed, and his whole house.

54.text: This second sign Jesus did, having come out of Judea into Galilee.
